From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesentiō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /presenˈtiɾ/

Verb

[edit]

presentir (first-person singular present presinto, third-person singular present presente, first-person singular preterite presentín, past participle presentido)

  1. (transitive) to have a feeling, have an idea

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of presentir (i-e alternation in present singular)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person

Further reading

[edit]
  • “presentir”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesentiō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾesenˈtiɾ/ [pɾe.sẽn̪ˈt̪iɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: pre‧sen‧tir

Verb

[edit]

presentir (first-person singular present presiento, first-person singular preterite presentí, past participle presentido)

  1. (transitive) to have a feeling, have an idea

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of presentir (e-ie-i alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive presentir
gerund presintiendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular presentido presentida
plural presentidos presentidas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
